page.title: 18THE WHITESTONE TILE WORKS
page.content: { The Whitestone Tile Works}stand in about 3 acres and employ 67 workers of which 17 are staff. They produce{glazed wall tiles}for kitchen and bathroom. The biscuit tiles they use are made from clay in Stoke-On-Trent. Most of the work is done by machine, including: painting, transfer, glazing and then firing in the kilns. The main sives produced are 6"x 6",6"x 8" and 8"x 4", there are about 150 designs in all. The finished tiles are sent to customers around the country and some are exported to Africa, Australia and the Arab States. A fire destroyed some of th offices in 1983, but Mr.Green, the manager, says that they will be rebuilt soon, and he hopes to increase production in the future.
